channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Can Merrick Garland find his inner Zelensky and stop Americaâ€™s slide into Putinism? https://t.co/kbPen16gZq
What Russian Officials Think of the Invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/wmzqEvSZx1

@dsearls itâ€™s smart to use printed tickets. I once got stuck in Las Vegas trying to get to San Francisco, plane crash at SFO. airline ticket system screwed up and my electronic ticket disappeared. I had to buy another ticket. Couldnâ€™t have happened if I had a paper ticket.
The west fell asleep on Cold War sentry duty and thought Putin couldnâ€™t be serious, but he was. The question remains, is NATO? https://t.co/nOIzt659Z3
The Fog of War is a great documentary on how crazy war is. https://t.co/QgLifNiYFg
Attackers can force Amazon Echos to hack themselves with self-issued commands. https://t.co/IZyRsqvv64
This SNL skit is extremely LOL funny. I'm not going to tell you what it's about. https://t.co/8nPHWvDz0y
This GEICO ad is LOL funny. https://t.co/TA6KNrAYtP
Worldâ€™s cartoonists on this weekâ€™s events. https://t.co/NE8IHx8koW
@ScottHansonDE I think you told me about that, maybe that's what put the idea in my head. ;-)

Another thing I heard but cannot place is that at one point Putin said he could buy anyone he wants. I wonder what would happen if Putin decided to talk to the people of the west, rather than rattling the cages of the people who own the west. Talk about a nuclear option. ;-)
@kamilkazani @KarlBode Also bribing people in power around the world with their kleptocratic proceeds.

I read somewhere that the reason Israel has to be careful with Russia is that a lot of the money backing Israeli tech startups comes from Russian oligarchs. It was a reputable source. I wish my brain had a History menu. ;-)
@jayrosen_nyu a reverse chronologic list of events would be helpful at a time like this.
@FlipperPA @TheIdOfAlan It doesn't follow that if there's an extension it's the name of a file. I use the file extension to help the server figure out how to render the data.
@TheIdOfAlan Here you go... https://t.co/TlYlL6Niwp
How to Measure Home Power Usage. https://t.co/GCMZuhkqQQ
This is why we do not want to turn Russia's internet off. https://t.co/vQDp57iHl2
@markphip everyone is sending me links to these systems, i know about them. i was writing about something else.
@webology i know about these products, but i want the electric company to send me an email at least every month. it's not just my bill i want to optimize, i think we should all get an upgrade.

Putin wants respect as a superpower. He wants us to think about him as daunting and menacing. He didn't know, after the election of 2016, he had us exactly where he wanted us. But his military apparently was his weakness. He should have kept that hidden.

1/7 Here's an idea of how to cut fuel consumption for electricity.
2/7 My electric bill has been going up, dramatically. Not sure how much this is due to rising energy cost, or my purchase of a Tesla electric car last year, or something else. I use electricity for lots of things. More all the time.
3/7 What's the difference in cost between keeping the thermostat at 65 vs 60? Maybe it's insignificant, or maybe it's very significant. I have no idea.
4/7 I have no tools to tell me what my electric consumption is graphed over time. If I did, I could for example, unplug the car and see how much the consumption goes down. Or turn down the thermostat to 60 and see what happens.
5/7 Who knows what my car is doing when I'm not watching? It has a mind of its own. Not like old cars that did nothing when they're turned off, my Tesla is always waking up and doing stuff. I bet that uses energy.
6/7 Maybe one of my devices is somehow malfunctioning and using a lot of energy and I could reduce consumption by replacing it, or leave it turned off unless I'm using it.
7/7 We're all flying blind. Let's create the tools to optimize energy use. I bet it would save a lot of money and be a good way to cut energy consumption.
